intro: Leucas hirta, commonly known as hairy leucas, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Leucas hirta is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
